## Proxy-pac.js
[![travis](https://img.shields.io/travis/com/xn-02f/Proxy-pac.js/master.svg?style=flat-square&logo=travis)](https://travis-ci.com/xn-02f/Proxy-pac.js)
[![gitlab-ci](https://img.shields.io/gitlab/pipeline/xn-02f/Proxy-pac.js/master.svg?style=flat-square&logo=gitlab)](https://gitlab.com/xn-02f/Proxy-pac.js/pipelines)
[![npm](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/proxy-pac.js.svg?style=flat-square&logo=npm)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/proxy-pac.js)
[![LICENSE](https://img.shields.io/npm/l/proxy-pac.js.svg?style=flat-square&logo=data:image/svg+xml;base64,)](https://github.com/xn-02f/Proxy-pac.js/blob/master/LICENSE)
> This is a file that set proxy auto-config(PAC).

**Usage** :
- Via npm:
```bash
$ npm install proxy-pac.js
```
- Import CDN:<br>
Type `https://unpkg.com/proxy-pac.js/dist/proxy-pac.min.js` (or other CDN url) in your system proxy setting.

These files can be used currently as pac file for your proxy (eg. shadowsocks) on linux, Mac, even Windows.

**Development** :
```bash
$ git clone --recurse-submodules git@github.com:xn-02f/Proxy-pac.js.git
$ cd Proxy-pac.js
$ npm i
$ npm run test && npm run dist
```

> LICENSE: [GPL-3.0](https://github.com/xn-02f/Proxy-pac.js/blob/master/LICENSE)
